metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a local attacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccid object as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel 5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and 3.2.0-149.196. Hadar Manor discovered that the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel improperly handled socket reuse, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-4.4.0-193-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-generic - 4.4.0-193.224
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-193-lowlatency - 4.4.0-193.224

notes.Note: sbeattie> patch applied to the ubuntu-kernels was NACKed by upstream. The subsequent revision submitted upstream still needs rework and has not been accepted as of 2021-01-13.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-193.224').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.131').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.91').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.151').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-193.224').
